data.title: The Mayville, Wisconsin Community
data.meta_description: Whether you're a resident or first-time visitor, we hope that your experience is rich and plentiful. Enjoy our history, present, and exciting future.
data.text:
Volunteer

The Mayville Area Chamber of Commerce can use your support! Do you have a volunteer program in your business? We would love to have you, your organization, or employees participate in any of the programs and events that the Chamber provides to the community. The Chamber will promote your business through social media and any ads done for the event, and you can wear and display your organization’s promotional materials!

Email us today at info@mayvillechamber.com and share your special skills with Mayville!

Business and Community Programs

Ambassadors’ Program

MACC Business & Citizen of the Year Awards and Dinner

Welcome New Families to the Community with Greeter Bags of Members’ Promotional Materials

Sell Raffle Tickets

Mayville Community

The Mayville School District serves approximately 1,100 students across three schools with a commitment to providing a quality educational environment and experience for the children of Mayville and the surrounding area.

The District’s mission is to foster innovation, empower learners and transform the learning experience. We promote a growth mindset in which learning is continuous and believe that all students can attain mastery of academic targets.

The Mayville community has shown its outstanding support for our schools through the recent completion of a $24.5 million construction and renovation project including the renovation of Mayville High School, the construction of a new state of the art fitness center, new technology education spaces, new agricultural science spaces, and capital maintenance/safety & security improvements at all three of our schools.

Mayville School District works collaboratively with local child care providers and preschools to offer 4K: St. Mary’s, St. John’s, Jaime’s Clubhouse and Parkview Primary. Each site has a highly-qualified, DPI-certified teacher who receives professional development and curriculum resources from the district. For more information call Becky LeBouton, 4K Coordinator and Parkview Principal at 920-387-7973 ext. 2002.

Grades 4K-2 – Parkview Primary School

located at 259 Oak St., Mayville, WI 53050

PH: 920-387-7973 ext. 2001

Phoenix Baby Pantry

We are located at the Horicon Phoenix Program Main Office at 319 E Lake Street on the lower level in Horicon, WI, and are open every Monday from 4-6 pm or by appointment.

Donations of cash and goods are welcome and sincerely appreciated.

Contact info:

319 East Lake St, Lower Level

Horicon, WI 53032

info@horiconphoenix.com

(920) 485-0216

Send us a message on our Facebook page to make an appointment:

www.facebook.com/hppbabypantryoricon Phoenix Baby Pantry

Sacred Heart in Horicon, WI

950 Washington Street

Horicon, WI 53032

Phone: (920) 485-0694

Fax: (920) 485-0906

The Food Pantry is open the first and third Wednesdays of the month, 9:00am – 1:00pm for indoor service. Please enter through the front office doors.
